# GTKX

> Build native GTK4 desktop apps for Linux using React and TypeScript. Not a webview - real native widgets.

## Getting Started

Create a new project with the CLI:

```bash
npx gtkx create my-app
cd my-app
npm install
npm run dev
```

## Core Concepts

Every GTKX app uses `render()` to mount a React component tree as native GTK widgets:

```tsx
import { render, GtkApplicationWindow, GtkButton, quit } from "@gtkx/react";

function App() {
  return (
    <GtkApplicationWindow title="My App" onCloseRequest={quit}>
      <GtkButton label="Click me" onClicked={() => console.log("clicked")} />
    </GtkApplicationWindow>
  );
}

render(<App />, "com.example.myapp");
```

## Widgets

GTK widgets are React components prefixed with `Gtk` or `Adw` (for Libadwaita):

- `GtkButton`, `GtkLabel`, `GtkEntry`, `GtkSwitch`, `GtkCheckButton`
- `GtkBox`, `GtkGrid`, `GtkStack`, `GtkPaned`, `GtkScrolledWindow`
- `GtkListView`, `GtkGridView`, `GtkColumnView`, `GtkDropDown`
- `GtkHeaderBar`, `GtkPopover`, `GtkDialog`, `GtkAlertDialog`
- `AdwApplicationWindow`, `AdwHeaderBar`, `AdwToastOverlay`, `AdwNavigationView`

Props map to GTK properties. Events use `on` prefix: `onClicked`, `onActivate`, `onCloseRequest`.

## Slots

Some widgets have named child positions. Use `Slot` to target them:

```tsx
import { Slot } from "@gtkx/react";

<GtkHeaderBar>
  <Slot for={GtkHeaderBar} id="titleWidget">
    <GtkLabel label="Custom Title" />
  </Slot>
</GtkHeaderBar>
```

## Styling

Use GTK CSS classes via the `cssClasses` prop:

```tsx
<GtkLabel label="Important" cssClasses={["title-1", "accent"]} />
<GtkButton label="Save" cssClasses={["suggested-action"]} />
```

Common Adwaita classes: `title-1` through `title-4`, `heading`, `body`, `caption`, `dim-label`, `accent`, `success`, `warning`, `error`, `suggested-action`, `destructive-action`.

For custom CSS, use `@gtkx/css`:

```tsx
import { css } from "@gtkx/css";

<GtkBox css={css`background: #333; padding: 12px;`}>
  {children}
</GtkBox>
```

## Enums

GTK enums are available from `@gtkx/ffi/gtk`:

```tsx
import { Gtk } from "@gtkx/ffi/gtk";

<GtkBox orientation={Gtk.Orientation.VERTICAL} spacing={12}>
  {children}
</GtkBox>
```

## Testing

Use `@gtkx/testing` for component tests:

```tsx
import { render, screen } from "@gtkx/testing";

test("button works", async () => {
  render(<MyComponent />);
  await screen.findByName("submit-btn").click();
  expect(await screen.findByName("status")).toHaveLabel("Done");
});
```

## Packages

- `@gtkx/react`: Core framework - components, render(), hooks
- `@gtkx/ffi`: GTK type definitions and enums
- `@gtkx/css`: CSS-in-JS styling
- `@gtkx/testing`: Test utilities
